II.i.2.C.5.a
.
Definition of Unidentifiable Mail
For purposes of mail control and accountability,
unidentifiable mail
is defined as any mail lacking identifying attributes or adequate information necessary to
conclusively identify an individual
associate the correspondence with an existing claims folder, or
create a new eFolder.
Important
:Â  All search options found in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart ii, 1.A.1
must be exhausted before categorizing mail as unidentifiable.
title: M21-1, Part II, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section C - Mail Management
citation: Part II, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section C
